item.title: Marvel Rivals: How To Get The Let Her Speak! & Whispers From The Web Achievements
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock The “Let Her Speak!” Achievement In Marvel Rivals
  • How To Unlock The “Whispers From The Web” Achievement In Marvel Rivals

Marvel Rivals is full of entertaining Easter eggs and special interactions between characters. These details add another layer of depth to this game's lore and the greater Marvel Universe. Easter eggs like the Stark-Fujikawa building in Tokyo 2099 and Bats the Ghost Dog have been put in by the developers as markers of Marvel's history.

Speaking of Tokyo 2099, the map itself contains a couple of achievements that many players seem to have trouble trying to unlock. This is because of the lack of information pertaining to the character with whom you’re supposed to interact with and where they can be found. For those struggling, here's how to find Spider-Zero and get the “Let Her Speak!” and “Whispers from the Web” achievements .

How To Unlock The “Let Her Speak!” Achievement In Marvel Rivals

This achievement requires players to talk to Spider-Zero on the Tokyo 2099 map , specifically the Spider Islands version. If you’re on the defending side, you’ll need to wait until you get to the attacker's first spawn room; the character can only be found there. Once you pick your character and spawn in the room, you will find Spider-Zero next to the main door that opens when the match starts .

She will be leaning against the railings at the bottom of the stairs. She wears her normal hero costume, which includes a spider mask, a brown jacket, blue jeans, and a backward cap.

Walking up to her will trigger her dialogue. Once triggered, Spider-Zero will start talking, and this will earn you the “Let Her Speak!” achievement. You don’t even need to pay attention to what she's saying or listen to the entire dialogue; just starting the voice line will reward you with the achievement.

How To Unlock The “Whispers From The Web” Achievement In Marvel Rivals

The “Whispers From the Web” achievement also tasks you with talking to Spider-Zero, but this time, you must do so in a different version of Tokyo 2099: the Shin Shibuya version. Again, you’ll need to be on the attacker's side to find Spider-Zero . If you’re on defense, simply play out the first half and wait until you swap sides. Once you’ve chosen your character and spawned into the spawn room, look toward the back , directly opposite the main door that opens up when the round starts .

Upon doing so, you’ll spot a holographic projecting box between the half-pipe ramp and a couple of old video game consoles. The box will also have an indicator on top that says, “Message from Spider-Zero,” making it a little easier for you to spot it.

You’ll be given a prompt to trigger the interaction once you get close enough to the box. Once you trigger it, you’ll see a hologram of Spider-Zero. The character will be in her usual attire and will begin rattling off some voice lines like before. Again, you don’t need to stick around to listen to the whole thing. Simply starting the interaction will earn you the “Whispers From the Web” achievement.

item.title: Infinity Nikki: How to Get the School Days Outfit
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Unlock the School Days Outfit in Infinity Nikki
  • All School Days Outfit Pieces in Infinity Nikki

The School Days outfit in Infinity Nikki is a nice set of pieces to have in your collection. It allows you to get a few different hairstyles, and it also contains a few accessories and a cute top and bottom. While these items can be useful in styling competitions, they can only be obtained by completing a few different quests.

If you are looking to add these pieces to your wardrobe, you will need to complete the correct quests and obtain each individual item in the set. If you are unsure where to start, here's a detailed rundown on how to get the School Days Outfit in Infinity Nikki .

How to Unlock the School Days Outfit in Infinity Nikki

In order to unlock all the pieces in the School Days outfit set, you will need to complete all the subquests in the Left for Home, Right for Wishes quest chain . This quest chain will appear after you complete:

  • Come on! Market of Mirth! Main Quest
  • Left for Home, Right for Wishes World Quest

The main quest occurs in Chapter 4, so it will be about halfway through your adventure before it is completed. Then, you can find the Left for Home, Right for Wishes questline in the Abandoned District, where you'll find Granny Lefty.

Before the questline unlocks, though, make sure to complete the Left for Home, Right for Wishes quest, which can be found in Breezy Meadow , shown in the map image above. This Random Quest is separate from the questline , despite having the same name. You will need to answer three different questions to wrap up the Random Quest, with the correct answers being:

  • The Sheep go "Baa" as they sleep in the hay
  • Pearl Wings chasing the sun across the sky
  • A Ruffin pokes its head from the water below

Then, head to the Meadow Activity Support Center and talk to Simone to get Akka's Sports Drink. Next, head back to the sheep farm, talk to the people nearby, and then return to Akka at the riverside. This will complete the Random Quest, allowing you to start the questline with Granny Lefty.

After teleporting to the Barrel Home Warp Spire , approach Granny Lefty and talk to her to get started. You will need to play her some music. Then, you will need to complete all six individual quests in the questline. They will be easy to get through and will unlock each piece individually without you having to craft them. The quests include:

  • She Doesn't Believe She'll Grow Up
  • Seeds of the Past Have Sprouted
  • Anonymous or Great Adventurer?
  • A Love Letter to Earth
  • At Least Plant One Flower
  • Ballade of Homeland's Final Page

All School Days Outfit Pieces in Infinity Nikki

After you've completed all the quests in the Left for Home, Right for Wishes questline, you will have all seven pieces of the School Days outfit, which you can use to make your own looks. These are all the items you will have access to, along with their stats:

item.title: The Sims 3: All Expansions Packs, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Island Paradise was a top-performing expansion in The Sims 3, but faced performance issues due to ambitious features.
  • The Pets expansion brought rich customization and variety to The Sims 3, enhancing gameplay with animal interactions.
  • Ambitions introduced direct job interactions, making it a standout in The Sims 3 series with engaging gameplay.

The Sims 3 is one of the most iconic and ambitious games in the series, introducing open-world exploration for the first time and offering unparalleled freedom to fans of the genre. Released in 2009, the title impressed with its immersive gameplay and rich character and building customization, allowing exploration of different aspects of this incredible life simulator.

Following the franchise's tradition, the game received various additional contents that further expanded its gameplay. The best expansion packs for The Sims 3 were those that added new mechanics, mysterious regions, and secrets to be explored, transforming the players' experience. These expansions elevated the game to a new level, making it even more diverse and engaging.

11 Showtime

The Promise Of A Spectacle That Never Came To Life

  • Release Date: March 6, 2012
  • Main Themes: Entertainment, Superstar Careers

Despite a fascinating premise focused on superstar careers, the result delivered by The Sims 3: Showtime was a disappointing expansion pack with little content for players. Additionally, many of the gameplay elements it possessed ended up overshadowing what already existed in the series, especially in the Late Night DLC, making the content repetitive.

However, even though much of the content related to Showtime may not be interesting to many players, some new items that came with the expansion are cool. Particularly the karaoke machine, which led to some fun interactions between characters, but even so, it failed to significantly expand the fun of a limited content theme.

10 Into The Future

Content That Doesn't Fit Well With The Rest Of The Game

  • Release Date: October 22, 2013
  • Main Themes: Futuristic World, Time Travel

Another expansion pack that suffers due to being more niche content in The Sims 3 is Into The Future . Although the additional content offers the opportunity to explore a futuristic world after the first trip to Oasis Landing, the created world for the DLC, the activities performed there lose some of their initial charm.

Furthermore, the futuristic aesthetics of this expansion pack for The Sims 3 , despite featuring well-made items, do not fit very well with the rest of the game's content, making them always seem a bit out of place with the setting. For some players, this may be a limitation, compensating more for science fiction fans.

9 Island Paradise

Excellent Expansion Pack, But Affected By Performance Issues

  • Release Date: June 25, 2013
  • Main Themes: Tropical Islands, Resorts

Island Paradise is among the best expansion packs for The Sims 3 , offering an attractive concept filled with cool content such as resorts, floating houses, and even the possibility to dive into specific points on the map. So, for players who enjoy a more beach-focused life simulation setting, this DLC is a treasure trove of content.

However, being one of the most ambitious expansions for The Sims 3 , Island Paradise suffered somewhat from performance issues, making it impossible for many players to enjoy all its content without problems. Thus, even though it offers many activities and interesting gameplay, it would have been better to cut some features to provide a smoother experience.

8 Pets

A Must-Have Expansion In Any The Sims Game

  • Release Date: October 18, 2011
  • Main Themes: Animals, Pet Customization

Being one of the most anticipated thematic packs in every new franchise release, The Sims 3 Pets enriched the gameplay by introducing a variety of animals to the game, such as cats, dogs, and even horses. The ability to interact with animals, along with their high level of customization, made the gameplay excellent.

At the same time, to make the most of what this pack had to offer, players needed to use some mods to improve performance, as there were some stray animals that could get stuck in parts of the map and cause a drop in performance. However, it remains an indispensable pack for players who love pets.

7 Supernatural

A Magical Expansion Great For Fans Of The Theme

  • Release Date: September 4, 2012
  • Main Themes: Magical Creatures, Mythical Beings

The Supernatural expansion pack brought a charming proposal to the game, adding magical creatures like witches, fairies, werewolves, and enhancing the vampires introduced previously. Although it is excellent and well-executed content, much of this content could have been part of Late Night , which already included vampires and nighttime themes.

On the other hand, Supernatural may not appeal to fans who prefer a more realistic and less fantastical approach to gameplay. For these players, the excess of magical elements can clash with the traditional life simulation style that The Sims 3 offers, making it an expansion focused on a more specific audience.

6 World Adventures

Vacation Trips Became More Fun With This Expansion Pack

  • Release Date: November 18, 2009
  • Main Themes: Travel, Exploration

The first expansion pack released for The Sims 3 was also one of the best in the game, introducing a series of activities for characters to do during vacations. The destinations were inspired by regions in France, Egypt, and China, each with an ambiance that captured the feeling of traveling to these locations and exclusive activities.

Of course, over time, such activities became repetitive after several trips, especially exploring similar tombs in Egypt, but during the first few times, the expansion pack considerably enriches the game. Additionally, it was even possible to purchase a house in these vacation destinations after a certain time.

5 University Life

Players Can Enjoy A New Setting For Their Sims

  • Release Date: March 5, 2013
  • Main Themes: College Experience, Social Groups

One of the best expansion packs for The Sims 3 , University Life delivers the university life experience to players, even though it slightly changes the overall gameplay. Here, the family simulation is set aside, with characters moving to colleges and experiencing more of this moment in school life.

The game also introduced Social Groups mechanics, where Sims can join one and unlock everything from exclusive interactions to an entirely new career upon completing all skills. So, despite offering a university life simulation and not going beyond, the expansion pack manages to do it very well.

4 Late Night

This The Sims 3 Dlc Brought Content For Nightlife

  • Release Date: October 26, 2010
  • Main Themes: Nightlife, Urban Environment

Although the celebrity system is not widely used by some players, Late Night also brought new interactions for nightlife, making it one of the best expansion packs for The Sims 3 . By including bars, clubs, and other activities, the DLC introduced new ways for players to explore the social aspects of Sims' lives, making it more fun.

Additionally, the city of Bridgeport, which accompanied the Expansion Pack, perfectly matched the Late Night theme, bringing a more urban region to the game, full of opportunities and content to engage in during the night. It was also in this update that vampires were introduced to The Sims 3 , further enhancing the overall quality of the pack.

3 Ambitions

Expansion Pack Expanded The Horizons Of The Sims 3

  • Release Date: June 1, 2010
  • Main Themes: Career Interaction, Work-Life Integration

Introducing an unprecedented mechanic in the franchise, the Ambitions DLC for The Sims 3 allowed players, for the first time, to directly interact with their Sims' jobs. The careers offering this new dynamic provided engaging gameplay, eliminating inactivity during work hours and adding an extra layer of fun and innovation to the experience.

Living up to its name, Ambitions delivered a generous amount of content for players. Besides interaction in the work environment, the pack, considered one of the best in the series, introduced a new city full of charismatic characters to interact with and small secrets waiting to be discovered during exploration.

2 Generations

The Most Complete Expansion Pack For The Sims 3

  • Release Date: May 31, 2011
  • Main Themes: Family Life, Life Stages

One of the best expansion packs for The Sims 3 is Generations , an essential DLC for almost all players, as it adds a lot of content for those who enjoy the game due to interactions and family relationships. The additional content adds significant depth to the gameplay, enhancing the overall experience.

Moreover, Sims of all ages gain new interactions in Generations , all designed for each specific moment in life. Thus, the game allows a more realistic simulation of the characters' life stories, expanding the activities that can be done as they age and making each stage of gameplay a unique experience.

1 Seasons

This Expansion Pack Brought More Life To The Sims Worlds

  • Release Date: November 13, 2012
  • Main Themes: Weather, Seasonal Activities

Bringing a dynamic climate, Seasons is the best expansion pack for The Sims 3 , with numerous changes to the gameplay that make it an essential DLC for all players. Upon its release, the changing seasons came with different unique activities, such as festivals and holidays that gave each season its own personality.

In addition to the various activities the game offered, the content of Seasons did not stop there, as it was through this expansion that aliens also arrived in The Sims 3 . Thus, the impeccable integration into the base game and the impact on story building and realism make this pack a favorite among players.

item.title: The 7 Rarest Cards in Pokemon TCG Pocket, Ranked
item.description:
Just like in the real-world trading card game on which it's based, most people's interest in Pokemon TCG Pocket lies in collecting cards rather than actually using them in battle. With this in mind, there are certain cards that every player wants to get their hands on at some point, although doing so can be a lot easier said than done.

The chances of getting the rarest cards in Pokemon TCG Pocket from packs are astronomically low. In fact, one of them can't be pulled from packs at all. It's this scarcity that makes them so highly desirable though, with some players using them to flex their incredible luck (or, in a lot of cases, the thickness of their wallets).

This list will not include time-limited promotional cards, as these can no longer be obtained in-game.

7 Mew ex (Gold Crown)

Mythical Island #86

Pretty much all of the rarest cards in Pokemon TCG Pocket are of gold crown rarity, making these the cards to look out for when pulling from packs. The Mythical Island expansion only has one of them, though, which makes life just a little bit easier for those hoping to get their hands on a gold crown Mew ex.

The chances of pulling gold crown Mew ex in the fourth slot of a Mythical Island pack are 0.040%, with the chances of getting it in the fifth slot being a fairly respectable 0.160%. Pokemon TCG Pocket ​​​​​'s God packs are even better, with players having a 5.555% of pulling gold crown Mew ex in all five slots should they ever be lucky enough to get one.

6 Palkia ex (Gold Crown)

Space-Time Smackdown #206

The decision to base Pokemon TCG Pocket 's Space-Time Smackdown expansion around Gen-4 Pokemon surprised a lot of people, with many having been expecting Gen-2 to get its turn in the spotlight next. Once that decision had been made though, Pakia and Dialga seemed like the obvious choices for the set's gold crown cards, and the developers duly delivered.

With just two gold crown cards on offer in Space-Time Smackdown, the chances of pulling Palkia's in the fourth slot of a regular pack are 0.020% and this improves to 0.080% in the fifth slot. The odds of pulling gold crown Palkia ex from a God pack are 3.846%, although players will only be able to get it when opening Palkia packs.

5 Dialga ex (Gold Crown)

Space-Time Smackdown #207

Just as Dialga is one of the rarest Pokemon in the fourth generation Pokemon games, so too is its gold crown ex card one of the rarest cards in Pokemon TCG Pocket . Players will need to get extremely lucky if they're ever to get their hands on it, with the odds of doing so falling squarely into one-in-several thousands territory.

Like its fellow creation Pokemon, the chances of pulling gold crown Dialga ex in the fourth or fifth slots of a regular pack are 0.020% and 0.080% respectively, regardless of which of the two pack types players choose. Again though, when it comes to God packs, gold crown Dialga ex will only be available from packs with Dialga on the front, with odds of 3.846% in all five slots.

4 Charizard ex (Gold Crown)

Genetic Apex #283

In the real-world TCG, Charizard cards tend to be the most desirable, so it's not too surprising to see that the popular fire-type Pokemon has one of the rarest cards in Pokemon TCG Pocket as well. Unsurprisingly, it's Charizard's gold crown ex variant that most players are chasing, though their chances of packing it really aren't that great.

The probability of getting a gold crown Charizard ex in the fourth slot of a regular pack is just 0.013%. Although still incredibly low, the fifth slot does offer significantly better odds at 0.053%. The chances of packing gold crown Charizard ex in a God pack Charizard pack are pretty decent at 5.000% in all five slots, although it's important to note that the odds of getting a God pack are just 0.050%.

3 Pikachu ex (Gold Crown)

Genetic Apex #284

When it comes to the most recognizable Pokemon, there are only really two serious contenders for the title. A lot of people know Charizard due to its high-value TCG cards, but significantly more are able to recognize Pikachu as a result of its prominence in the Pokemon anime and its status as the series' defacto mascot. As such, it makes sense that Pikachu has its own rare Pokemon TCG Pocket card.

Gold crown Pikachu ex can be pulled in all five slots of a Pikachu pack with odds of 5.000% if players end up getting a God pack, but most will never be this lucky. Instead, they'll have to rely on fourth slot odds of just 0.013% in regular packs, with the chances of gold crown Pikachu ex showing up in the fifth slot being marginally better at 0.053%​​​​​.

2 Mewtwo ex (Gold Crown)

Genetic Apex #285

The term "genetic apex" could be interpreted as being the pinnacle of evolution. As such, it seems only fitting that Mewtwo was chosen to be one of the three pack cover Pokemon for Pokemon TCG Pocket 's Genetic Apex set. This ultimately led to the Mew clone being treated to its very own gold crown ex variant, which is one of the rarest cards in Pokemon TCG Pocket .

The chances of pulling gold crown Mewtwo ex are exceedingly low, with fourth and fifth slot odds of just 0.013% and 0.053% respectively in regular Genetic Apex packs. If players are opening Mewtwo packs and are somehow lucky enough to get a God pack, there's a 5.000% chance of pulling gold crown Mewtwo ex in all five card slots, but one does not simply get a God pack in Pokemon TCG Pocket ​​​​​​.

1 Mew (Immersive)

Genetic Apex #286

Unlike all of the other rare cards in Pokemon TCG Pocket , Mew isn't a gold crown card. Believe it or not, this particular Mew card isn't even an ex. What makes it so rare is that it cannot be pulled directly from packs, with players instead needing to collect one of every Gen-1 Pokemon from the Genetic Apex expansion in order to unlock this ultra-rare Mew immersive card.

Although none of these 150 cards are all that difficult to come by on their own, collecting all of them together can be incredibly difficult. Shortly after the game's release, somebody calculated that it would cost Pokemon TCG Pocket players around $1,500 to complete the Genetic Apex expansion if they were to use real-world money, although the addition of trading since then has thankfully made getting immersive Mew a little easier.

item.title: Manor Lords: The Best Items To Export & Trade
item.description:
Summary

  • Focus on exporting shoes, tools, and warbows for high profits in Manor Lords.
  • Utilize trade routes and assign families to manage inventory efficiently.
  • Make surplus bread in fertile regions and utilize deep mines for unlimited resources.

Once players have got their village up and running in Manor Lords , it won't be long till they can start exporting surplus goods to generate Regional Wealth. To start trading, players need to build a Trading Post and assign at least one family who will travel to trade destinations and manage the inventory. Hiring and assigning a horse to the Trading Post will also help speed up the entire process.

Practically any food, resource, or goods can be traded, and to do so, players need to select the export option on the left-hand side and then set a minimum surplus value, so that the item in question is sold until the number is reached. Some items require trade routes to be set up, which costs an upfront amount of Regional Wealth. Even when this isn't necessary, it can be a good idea for goods that will be exported a lot, as a dedicated merchant from outside the village will transport them. In terms of the best items to export in Manor Lords , players should focus on goods that fetch a high price and are easy to produce.

Updated January 30, 2025, by Joe Grantham: As a game in Early Access, there have been many updates to Manor Lords, both big and small, and many more can be expected. Players now have a few different goods to produce and trade, and balance updates mean that numbers and prices have shifted. There is also a new trade screen for players to see previous transactions.

1 Fish

No Process Required Other Than Catching Them

  • Export Price: 3
  • Trade Route Cost: 30
  • Produced: Fishing Hut by a pond

Fishponds are among the new additions to Manor Lords , and like other resource nodes, they randomly spawn in different parts of the map. Players lucky enough to have one in their home region can then build Fishing Huts and assign a family to work there and catch fish.

They work similarly to the wild animals resource in the way that levels must be managed. For example, if players let their workers catch all the fish, then the stock would be depleted and they would never get any more fish. Other than that, there is nothing else to consider and no other step. This makes them ideal for exporting, as 3 Regional Wealth for a one-step process is worth the time. Of course, players should only export food if they have enough to feed their settlement, especially in winter. Speaking of winter, ponds will usually freeze over, but with a new Development Point for Manor Lords , fishing can continue during the colder months.

2 Shoes

The Only Product Made Using Leather, So Players Will Have A Surplus

  • Export Price: 8
  • Trade Route Cost: 48
  • Produced: At the Cobbler's Workshop using Leather

It's likely that players will acquire lots of Hides even if they don't mean to, as hunters will produce them as a bonus to more desirable Meat. Hides are then turned into Leather at the Tannery, but the only current use for Leather is making them into Shoes at the Cobbler's Workshop.

Therefore, players will eventually end up with lots of Shoes, which will easily satisfy the requirements of higher-level villagers, helping the player maintain a high Approval Rating. Beyond what is needed, players can export the rest and fetch quite a high price.

3 Tools

No Current Use Other Than Trade

  • Export Price: 6
  • Trade Route Cost: 60
  • Produced: At the Smithy and Blacksmith's Workshop using Iron Slabs

As Manor Lords is in Early Access, many features are a work in progress, and thus some items currently serve no purpose other than as an export product. Tools are a good example of this, and as the only product made at the Smithy, players can manufacture lots of them to sell.

Tools are also produced at a Blacksmith's Workshop, a Backyard Extension in Manor Lords . While players will often want to make weapons here for their militia, the fact that Tools only require Iron Slabs and nothing else means players will want to manually assign them to be made, when supplies are missing for Planks. Naturally, Tools are best made in a region with a rich Iron deposit.

4 Warbows

The Only Product Of The Fletcher's Workshop & Sell For A Good Price

  • Export Price: 5
  • Trade Route Cost: 50
  • Produced: By Fletcher's from 4 Planks

Once players have figured out how to run the Sawpit efficiently in Manor Lords , they will be able to churn out lots of Planks. These Planks have plenty of uses, especially in construction, but they can also be used to produce Warbows at the Fletcher's Workshop. This workshop is a Backyard Extension and like other workshops, it requires the Burgage Plot to be at least level 2.

If players have a militia unit of archers, they will naturally want to provide them with enough bows, but beyond that, all Warbows can be exported at the Trading Post for a good price. As with any commodity though, players will want to watch out for the market becoming oversupplied with specific items, as the export price goes down. Therefore, sometimes it can be a good idea to hit the pause button on the Fletcher's Workshop.

5 Bread

If The Region Has Good Fertility, Players Can Make Lots Of Surplus Bread

  • Export Price: 4
  • Trade Route Cost: 40
  • Produced: From Flour in Communal Ovens or Bakery Extensions, after Wheat has been threshed into Grain

Not every region is good for farming in Manor Lords , but when players spawn in a location with high fertility for Wheat, they can eventually produce an exceptional amount of bread, the surplus of which can be exported for a solid price.

To produce Bread from Wheat, players will first need their farm workers to thresh the Wheat into Grain, and this Grain can then be taken to the Windmill to be turned into Flour. In terms of cooking the bread, most players will use the Communal Ovens, but dipping into the Bakeries Development Point unlocks new Backyard Extensions that are capable of cooking Bread much faster. For players interested in exporting Bread, this is definitely an upgrade they should aim for, especially as it requires the Heavy Plow to be unlocked first, which is crucial for farming large fields.

6 Any Resource From A Rich Deposit With A Deep Mine

A Deep Mine Ensures Unlimited Supply Of A Resource

In some ways, the best items to trade in Manor Lords depend on the region players spawn in and what resources are available to them. For example, a region that has a rich Iron deposit, paired with the Deep Mining Development Point, can produce infinite Iron Ore, which can be processed into Iron Slabs at the Bloomeries, and then made into all manner of items.

Players could export the Iron Slabs without any further processing, or to keep the market more balanced, they could export all the Iron products. While Stone can't currently be made into anything, and Clay can only be made into Roof Tiles, these are nonetheless good resources to trade when the player has an unlimited supply.
